-- | Dynamic client interface. This is a low-level module.
--   By all means, don't use it directly. Use "OnPing.DataServer.Client"
--   instead.
module OnPing.DataServer.AwayServer (
    -- * Types
    AwayServerType (..)
  , AwayServer (..)
  , deadEndServer
    -- * Client interface
  , clientTransfer
  , TransferResponse (..)
  , clientDeleteChunk
  , clientDeleteChunkPlease
  , clientInsertChunk
    -- * Request primitives
  , generateFilePath
  , httpRequest
  , jsonRequest
  ) where

-----------------------------------------------------
-- Import list

-- Base (Control)
import Control.Applicative ((<$>))
import Control.Arrow (left)

-- Base (Concurrency)
import Control.Concurrent (threadDelay)

-- Base (Data)
import Data.Maybe (fromMaybe)
import Data.Char (chr)

-- HTTP client-side library
import Network.HTTP
          ( RequestMethod (..)
          , Header (..)
          , HeaderName (..)
          , Request (..)
          , Response (..)
          , simpleHTTP
            )
import Network.URI (URI (..), URIAuth (..))

-- Aeson
import Data.Aeson (FromJSON,eitherDecode)

-- ByteString's
import Data.ByteString.Lazy (ByteString)
import qualified Data.ByteString.Lazy as B

-- S3 library
import Network.AWS.AWSConnection (AWSConnection (..))
import Network.AWS.S3Object
          ( S3Object (..)
          , getObject
          , deleteObject
          , sendObject
            )
import Network.AWS.AWSResult (ReqError (..))

-----------------------------------------------------
-- Types

-- | Supported types of 'AwayServer'.
data AwayServerType =
    OnPingData       -- ^ OnPing Data Server.
  | S3 String String -- ^ S3 Storage Server. It requires Key ID and Access Key.
  | DeadEnd          -- ^ Dead End Server. It contains nothing. Use this when
                     --   there is no server to connect.
    deriving Show

-- | A server to store unused values. It consists
--   on a type of server, which specifies the way
--   we communicate, its direction (IP or URL), and
--   port.
data AwayServer = AwayServer AwayServerType String Int

-- | A dead end away server with default configuration.
--   It throws an error if you use it in the wrong way.
deadEndServer :: AwayServer
deadEndServer = AwayServer DeadEnd (error "Dead End URL") (error "Dead End Port")

instance Show AwayServer where
  show (AwayServer t url p) = show t ++ "@" ++ url ++ ":" ++ show p

-----------------------------------------------------
-- HTTP Request abstractions

-- | Send an HTTP request and expect a JSON 'Value'
--   in return. If a non-JSON response is emitted,
--   returns a parsing error message.
jsonRequest :: FromJSON a
            => String -- ^ Request URL or IP
            -> Int -- ^ Port to make the request
            -> String -- ^ Request route
            -> RequestMethod -- ^ Request method
            -> Maybe ByteString -- ^ Request content
            -> IO (Either String a) -- ^ Parsed JSON response
jsonRequest url p path m b = do
  eres <- httpRequest url p path m b
  return $ case eres of
    Left err -> Left err
    Right res -> eitherDecode $ rspBody res

-- | Send an HTTP request, and return the response.
httpRequest :: String -- ^ Request URL or IP
            -> Int -- ^ Port to make the request
            -> String -- ^ Request route
            -> RequestMethod -- ^ Request method
            -> Maybe ByteString -- ^ Request content
            -> IO (Either String (Response ByteString)) -- ^ Response
httpRequest url p path m b = do
  let -- Headers
      body = fromMaybe B.empty b
      hs = [Header HdrContentLength $ show $ B.length body]
      -- Request
      req = Request (URI "http:" (Just $ URIAuth [] url (':' : show p)) path [] []) m hs body
  -- Only for Debugging
  -- putStrLn $ "Sending HTTP request: " ++ show req
  -- Send request
  left show <$> simpleHTTP req

-----------------------------------------------------
-- S3 data

generateFilePath :: Int -- ^ PID
                 -> Int -- ^ Initial time
                 -> FilePath
generateFilePath pid t = "data/" ++ show pid ++ "/" ++ show t

dataBucket :: String
dataBucket = "plow-datastorage" -- This name has to be checked for uniqueness

generateObject :: Int -- ^ PID
               -> Int -- ^ Initial time
               -> S3Object
generateObject pid t =
  S3Object dataBucket
           (generateFilePath pid t) -- Object name
           "binary/octet-stream" -- Content type
           [] -- Headers
           B.empty -- Object data

-----------------------------------------------------
-- Specific requests

-- | Sum type of responses from a 'clientTransfer'.
data TransferResponse =
         TransferFound ByteString
       | TransferNotFound
       | TransferError String

-- | Ask the 'AwayServer' to transfer a chunk of data.
clientTransfer :: AwayServer
               -> Int -- ^ PID
               -> Int -- ^ Initial time
               -> IO TransferResponse
---------------
clientTransfer (AwayServer OnPingData url p) pid t =
  let path = "/transfer/" ++ show pid ++ "/" ++ show t
  in  do eres <- httpRequest url p path GET Nothing
         return $ case eres of
           Left err -> TransferError err
           Right res ->
             case rspCode res of
               (4,0,4) -> TransferNotFound
               (2,0,0) -> TransferFound $ rspBody res
               (x,y,z) -> TransferError $ "Unknown response code received ("
                              ++ show x ++ show y ++ show z
                              ++ ")."
---------------
clientTransfer (AwayServer DeadEnd _ _) _ _ = return TransferNotFound
---------------
clientTransfer (AwayServer (S3 kid secret) url p) pid t = do
  let c = AWSConnection url p kid secret
  res <- getObject c $ generateObject pid t
  case res of
    Left awserr ->
      case awserr of
        NetworkError err -> return $ TransferError $ show err
        AWSError code message -> do
          putStrLn $ "[clientTransfer] AWS Error (" ++ code ++ "): " ++ message
          return TransferNotFound
    Right obj -> return $ TransferFound $ obj_data obj

-- | Ask the 'AwayServer' to delete a full chunk. Returns 'True' if the chunk
--   was successfully deleted.
clientDeleteChunk :: AwayServer
                  -> Int -- ^ PID
                  -> Int -- ^ Initial time
                  -> IO (Either String Bool)
---------------
clientDeleteChunk (AwayServer OnPingData url p) pid t =
  let path = "/delete-chunk/" ++ show pid ++ "/" ++ show t
  in  do eres <- httpRequest url p path PUT Nothing
         return $ case eres of
           Left err -> Left err
           Right res ->
             case rspCode res of
               (5,0,3) -> Right False
               (2,0,0) -> Right True
               (x,y,z) -> Left $ "HTTP/delete-chunk: Unknown response code received ("
                              ++ show x ++ show y ++ show z
                              ++ ")."
---------------
-- Dead end contains nothing by definition, so anything is already deleted.
clientDeleteChunk (AwayServer DeadEnd _ _) _ _ = return $ Right True
---------------
clientDeleteChunk (AwayServer (S3 kid secret) url p) pid t = do
  let c = AWSConnection url p kid secret
  res <- deleteObject c $ generateObject pid t
  case res of
    Left awserr ->
      case awserr of
        NetworkError err -> return $ Left $ show err
        AWSError code message -> do
          putStrLn $ "[clientDeleteChunk] AWS Error (" ++ code ++ "): " ++ message
          return $ Right False
    _ -> return $ Right True

-- | Ask the 'AwayServer' to delete a full chunk repeatedly until the server reports
--   that it was successfully removed, or the client gets tired of asking (maximum
--   number of tries). Note that it won't try again if an error is received. Only if
--   the request reached the server, and the server answered that the chunk could not be
--   removed. As in 'clientDeleteChunk', it returns 'True' when the chunk was
--   successfully removed. If 'False' is returned, it means the maximum number of tries
--   was reached.
clientDeleteChunkPlease :: AwayServer
                        -> Int -- ^ PID
                        -> Int -- ^ Initial time
                        -> Int -- ^ Maximum number of tries
                        -> IO (Either String Bool)
clientDeleteChunkPlease _ _   _ 0 = return $ Right False
clientDeleteChunkPlease s pid t m = do
  eres <- clientDeleteChunk s pid t
  case eres of
    Left err -> return $ Left err
    Right b -> if b then return $ Right True
                    else do threadDelay $ 10 ^ (6 :: Int) -- wait one second before asking again :)
                            clientDeleteChunkPlease s pid t (m-1)

-- | Send a chunk to 'AwayServer', and insert it at the given PID and initial time.
--   If any error occurs in the process, a 'String' is returned.
--   Note that if the away server detects a valid header, it will accept the bytestring,
--   /even if it contains corrupted data/. Make sure that the bytestring you are sending
--   is an encoded binary store before calling this function.
--
--   When sending to 'DeadEnd', this function does nothing (and returns 'Nothing').
--   Sending a chunk to oblivion is not supposed to be an error (or is it?).
clientInsertChunk :: AwayServer
                  -> Int -- ^ PID
                  -> Int -- ^ Initial time
                  -> ByteString -- ^ Chunk to send
                  -> IO (Maybe String)
clientInsertChunk (AwayServer OnPingData url p) pid t b =
  let path = "/insert-chunk/" ++ show pid ++ "/" ++ show t
  in  do eres <- httpRequest url p path PUT $ Just b
         return $ case eres of
           Left err -> Just err
           Right res ->
             case rspCode res of
               (4,0,0) -> Just $ "Malformed header: " ++ fmap (chr . fromIntegral)
                                                              (B.unpack $ rspBody res)
               (5,0,0) -> Just $ "Server error: " ++ fmap (chr. fromIntegral) (B.unpack $ rspBody res)
               (2,0,0) -> Nothing
               (x,y,z) -> Just $ "HTTP/insert-chunk: Unknown response code received ("
                              ++ show x ++ show y ++ show z
                              ++ ")."
---------------
clientInsertChunk (AwayServer DeadEnd _ _) _ _ _ = return Nothing
---------------
clientInsertChunk (AwayServer (S3 kid secret) url p) pid t b = do
  let c = AWSConnection url p kid secret
      obj0 = generateObject pid t
  res <- sendObject c $ obj0 { obj_data = b }
  case res of
    Left awserr ->
      case awserr of
        NetworkError err -> return $ Just $ show err
        AWSError code message -> return $ Just $ code ++ ":  " ++ message
    _ -> return Nothing
